result.execSummary:
The defendant Alberto B Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 10:38am [mo]
Defendant Alberto B Rivera in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest  " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Rivera   guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #2

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Rivera 

On Count #1:
The Court sentences Mr. Rivera  to 4   years in the Wisconsin State Prison , with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to Waukesha County Case #13CF1486 and any other sentence in being

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives   0  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--not to possess or consume of alcohol
--no operation of any vehicle
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent
--Victim impact panel attendance
--To pay fine of $600+ costs= $1,819  plus blood testing fees in the amount of $56.74 to JESO= $1,875.74
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

The Court orders: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 11:15am

Preliminary hearing at 08-11-2015 08:00 am
Preliminary hearing at 08-11-2015 08:00 am
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:21 pm [sf]
Defendant Alberto B Rivera in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney De La Rosa advises the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Address and DOB information verified.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of any alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
-The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit, demanded by the State.

Recess: 1:26 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 8/11/15 at 8:00 am
